name: Latinx Studies
descriptions: The Latinx Studies minor offers a deeper understanding of the cultures and traditions of the Latin world and its significance on American life. This interdisciplinary program develops critical thinking about culture's role in the global community.
With Latinx populations comprising approximately 18% of the U.S. population, understanding these communities prepares graduates for careers in policy, marketing, law, and business sectors.

electiveCourses.description: 15 hours from courses across at least three different departments. Other relevant courses may count pending approval from the Director of the Latinx Studies Program.

features: Interdisciplinary curriculum spanning arts, humanities, and social sciences
Connected to Comparative Race & Ethnic Studies department
